Based on the preferences you've expressed, I would recommend "Timecrimes" (2007). This film follows a man who accidentally travels back in time nearly an hour. As he navigates through the different time periods, the movie takes turns with thrilling twists and turns that keep the audience on their toes.
Another option would be to recommend "Virtuosity" (1995). This film is based on a true story about a man who was falsely accused of murder and spent 23 years in prison before finally being exonerated. The movie explores the psychological effects that come with false accusations, as well as the process of seeking justice and clearing one's name.
In conclusion, both "Timecrimes" (2007) and "Virtuosity" (1995) are excellent options to consider if you're looking for thrilling movies that will keep you on your toes.

Based on your preferences and given the available information, I would recommend "Gone Girl" as a great option for you.

"Gone Girl" is a gripping psychological thriller directed by David Fincher. The movie stars Ben Affleck and Rosamund Pike in lead roles.

The plot revolves around the disappearance of Rachel Taylor, a young woman who lives in a small town near the coast of New England, United States.

As the investigation into her disappearance progresses, tensions between Rachel's husband, Nick, and Rachel's best friend, Amy, increase, ultimately leading to unexpected twists and turns in the plot.

Overall, "Gone Girl" is an intense psychological thriller directed by David Fincher. The movie stars Ben Affleck and Rosamund Pike in lead roles.
